Title:
The invasive medicinal plant Piper aduncum supporting a new
Pseudocercospora species
Abstract:
The interest on Piper aduncum arises from the double
relevance of this plant species which is exploited as medicinal
compounds source and it is recognized as an important invasive plant
species in Papua New Guine. A cercosporoid fungus was found associated
with this plant and its morphological characterization allowed
identifying it as a new Pseudocercospora species. This new species is
described and illustrated below, and the identifying key for
Pseudocercospora species associated with Piperaceae was reviewed.
